template.name: Template Net Mellanox SNMP
template.description:
The updated template for monitoring the Mellanox network switches over SNMP agent. All items collected in one template without any linked templates.
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB ENTITY-SENSORS-MIB ENTITY-STATE-MIB ENTITY-MIB IF-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.38

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:icmppingloss.min(5m)}>{$ICMP.LOSS.WARN} and {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:icmppingloss.min(5m)}<100

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: Item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that processors was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

trigger.name: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: Uptime
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Hardware model name
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Hardware serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB

trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-SENSORS-MIB The most recent measurement obtained by the agent for this sensor. To correctly interpret the value of this object, the associated entPhySensorType, entPhySensorScale, and entPhySensorPrecision objects must also be examined.

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan status
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-SENSORS-MIB The operational status of the sensor {#SENSOR_INFO}

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned NumbersAuthority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].change()}<0 and {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0 and ( {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=6 or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=7 or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=11 or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=62 or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=69 or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=117 ) and ({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].change()}>0 and {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].prev()}>0) or ({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} and {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Power supply status
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-STATE-MIB

trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Temperature status
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-SENSORS-MIB The operational status of the sensor {#SENSOR_INFO}. Possible values: - ok(1) indicates that the agent can obtain the sensor value. - unavailable(2) indicates that the agent presently cannot obtain the sensor value. - nonoperational(3) indicates that the agent believes the sensor is broken. The sensor could have a hard failure (disconnected wire), or a soft failure such as out-of-range, jittery, or wildly fluctuating readings.

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-SENSORS-MIB The most recent measurement obtained by the agent for this sensor. To correctly interpret the value of this object, the associated entPhySensorType, entPhySensorScale, and entPhySensorPrecision objects must also be examined.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP.MAX.CRIT:"{#SENSOR_INFO}"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP.MAX.WARN:"{#SENSOR_INFO}"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

item_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Space utilization
item_prototype.description: Space utilization in % for {#FSNAME}

item_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main storage allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual storage might be modified.

item_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<10G or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
dependency.expression: {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.total[hrStorageSize.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.used[hrStorageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template Net Mellanox SNMP:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

item_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: Total memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: Used memory
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: Memory utilization
item_prototype.description: Memory utilization in %

trigger_prototype.name: {#MEMNAME}: High memory utilization ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free memory.

macro.description: The critical value of the FAN sensor for trigger expression.
This macro is used in memory discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in memory discovery. Can be overridden on the host level if you need to filter out results.
This macro is used in memory discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in memory discovery. Can be overridden on the host level if you need to filter out results.
The warning threshold of the "Physical memory: Memory utilization" item.
Ignore notPresent(6)
Ignore down(2) administrative status.
Filter out loopbacks, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default.
Ignore notPresent(6).
The critical value of the PSU sensor for trigger expression.
The time interval for SNMP agent availability trigger expression.
The temperature maximum critical value for trigger expression.
The temperature maximum warning value for trigger expression.
The temperature minimum critical value for trigger expression.
The critical value of the TEMP sensor for trigger expression.
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host level.
